content: hardinge road cowl by maree buscke © maree buscke for macbuscke knits this pattern is for personal use not for commercial reproduction or sale hardinge road is a cowl inspired by the road that runs hardinge alongside the ocean in ahuriri where i live this my favourite place to walk i often grab a cowl to toss on to keep myself warm they are quick and less bulky that a scarf road cowl or shawl whether it s walking the dog or sitting outside soaking up the view along the ahuriri boardwalk it all happens along hardinge road materials one 50gm ball each of dk yarn 113m in three colours if using a dk of 100m you will require a second 50gm ball for the main colour pair 4mm & 4 5mm circular needles on0 an 80cm cable for working in the round stitch marker 1 wool needle for sewing in ends abbreviations k knit p purl pm- place marker sm slip marker st stitch sl1 slip one stitch purlwise k2tog knit two stitched together yfwd bring yarn forward to the front of your work yb bring yarn to the back of your work m1 make one by picking up the bar between the two stitches and knitting into the back of the loop stocking stitch one row knit one row purl instructions keeping your colour sequencing correct repeat previous four rounds until you have completed eleven sequences of using 4mm needles cast on 148 sts in contrast colour of all three colours with the final two rounds being in the main choice optional see note ** colour join in the round being careful not to twist stitches then ultimately you can do as many sequences as you like you will pm get into the rhythm of the pattern very quickly if you have additional meterage of main colour you decide your depth change to main colour just end your sequence in the main colour 1st round k2 p2 rib until end of round staying with main colour repeat 2 x 2 ribbing for 7 row of rib next round knit decreasing 4 sts using a k2tog evenly and work 2 x 2 rib and increase by 4 sts using a m1 spaced immediately after a contrast colour slipped stitch 148sts evenly and increased in the knit portions of the rib 152sts you should have 8 row of rib completed k2 p2 rib until end of round work 5 more rounds in rib 6 in total change to 4 5mm needles the last rounds of pattern in the main colour give the you will be working two rounds of each colour starting optical illusion of additional ribbing hence 6 rounds not 8 with the main colour repeating over the four round at the end this gives a more balanced final look pattern repeat below eg mc c1 c2 knit two rounds each and repeat change to contrast colour knit one round pattern repeat cast off purlwise round 1 k1 yfwd
